intro: Alchemilla debilis, commonly known as slender alchemilla, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Alchemilla debilis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to stabilize soil in wet conditions.
